meanings.definition: A substance used to fill in cracks or holes in walls.
meanings.sent1: I bought some spackles to fix the holes in the wall.
meanings.sent2: The painter applied spackles to the cracks before painting the wall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the spackles were a new type of treat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room like spackles filling in the gaps of silence.
meanings.sent5: The spackles blended seamlessly with the wall, hiding any imperfections.

meanings.definition: To fill in cracks or holes with spackles.
meanings.sent1: I will spackles the cracks in the wall this weekend.
meanings.sent2: She carefully spackles the holes to prepare for painting.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they tried to spackles the holes with playdough.
meanings.sent4: His words spackles the broken relationship, bringing them closer together.
meanings.sent5: The artist spackles the canvas with vibrant colors, creating a masterpiece.
